This festive season visitors to Gateway can look forward to an exciting, sparkling and fun filled experience. There is something for everyone. Children can look forward to a larger-than-life Toyland and the shopper competition will put shoppers in line to win daily prizes valued at over R500 000 with the overall prize being a shopping trip to Mumbai.

Partygoers and music lovers can look forward to some of the hottest international DJ’s on New Year’s Eve, an event for Durban’s trend setters on Sunday, 14 December and Justin Bieber fans will be treated to a spectacular production at the Barnyard Theatre when they host Bieber and Buddies.

Gateway’s Toyland

During the festive season Gateway and Toys R Us will create a larger than life Toyland experience in the Expo Xplore area near the Wave House. Children will be treated to: photos with Santa; character meet and greets including Toys R Us’ Geoffrey the Giraffe; electronic car tracks with Ride-Ons; PlayStation units; LEGO; colouring in stations and more. The kids’ court will run from Saturday, 6 to Wednesday, 24 December from 09:00 to 19:00 daily. Entrance into the court will cost R20 per person.

So You Think You Can Shop?

In the days leading up to Christmas, Gateway shoppers will be invited to engage in an exciting challenge that will test their knowledge of the mall. The campaign will be launched on Thursday, 20 November and shoppers stand to win amazing daily prizes including: a trip to Mumbai; jewellery; dining experiences; fashion vouchers; as well as beauty hampers. The overall winner who will win the trip to Mumbai will be announced on Wednesday, 24 December.

The Wave House

Ibiza World Tour Durban

When it comes to electro and house music DJ’s, the pinnacle of success is playing in one of the famous clubs in Ibiza. Eight of the ten DJ’s on the Ibiza World Tour will be at the Wave House this New Year’s Eve.

The lineup includes: young duo, Cedric and Edgar who go by the name of Klingande (France); a DJ who has achieved worldwide success, Michael Calfan (France); one of America’s finest, Peyton; the messenger for house and techno music, Da Cat (France); one of South Africa’s best duos, Pascal and Pearce; the new phenomenon from the Netherlands, Dennis Kruissen; Deep Café pioneer, Nigel Stately; experimental DJ, Kool & Kabul (Germany) as well as Belgium DJ, C Delgado.

Tickets are available at Computicket at R540 for general access and R1800 for VIP.

GoodSundae

GoodSundae creates an experience away from the club scene. KwaZulu-Natal’s biggest urban market trend setters have been seen at previous GoodSundae events. They come to do what they love – to see and to be seen. This event will see performances by some of South Africa’s best artists.

Tickets are available at Computicket at R150 for general access and R250 for VIP.

The Barnyard Theatre

Bieber and Buddies

Teens are in for a treat this festive season when The Barnyard Theatre at Gateway hosts, Bieber and Buddies on Thursday, 20 and Thursday, 27 December as well as Saturday, 3 and Saturday, 10 January 2015.

The Kidz Rock band, singers and dancers will take audiences on an awesome journey with three boys who have a desire to be Justin Bieber. Yes, they want look like, dance like and sound like their hero, but what will their friends (especially girlfriends) think, and what will their challenges be when they strive to achieve their goal? Never say Never as these buddies reach for their dream which is to stage a Bieber concert at their high school.

Tickets are only R90 per person. The theatre opens at 12:30 and the show starts at 14:00. For bookings and enquiries, phone the Barnyard Theatre on 031 566 3045 or email [email protected].

Festive Season Trading Hours:

- Friday, 5 December to Thursday, 11 December from 09:00 to 21:00;

- Friday, 12 December to Tuesday, 23 December from 09:00 to 22:00;

- Wednesday, 24 December from 09:00 to 21:00;

- Thursday, 25 December: Voluntary Trading;

- Friday, 26 December to Tuesday, 30 December from 09:00 to 21:00;

- Wednesday, 31 December from 09h00 – 20h00;

- Thursday, 1 January 2015: Voluntary Trading;

- Friday, 2 January to Saturday, 3 January 2015 from 09:00 to 21:00; and

- Sunday, 4 January 2015 from 09:00 to 21:00.

Normal trading hours will resume from Monday, 5 January 2015

During the festive season the main priority is safeguarding shoppers and tenants. Additional security personnel have been allocated to enhance security during this time. Gateway is continuously working with the local police services to ensure that the correct measures are in place in the event of an emergency.

In addition to this, retailers who have their own security arrangements within their own premises, operate their own surveillance cameras in their areas. All security technologies are checked constantly and all efforts are made to increase tenant and shopper awareness around this period as well. Gateway advises shoppers to always be vigilant and careful with their personal belongings – either in their vehicles or on their person.

Shoppers should not leave any valuables in their vehicles and should physically check that their vehicles are locked when using a remote locking device.
